Replies.Reply: Hi... My name is Mary O'Reilly O'Toole O'Shea and...over there is the island my friend Muffy owns... It's spring break... and she's invited us over for the weekend, and we're waiting for the ferry now to take us there...
I don't know what else to say!
Well, I want to work with handicapped children... My parents are my best Friends... Next semester I start convent school, and I... fuck on the first date.
Oh, c'mon, Chaz, give me some room, will you?
Excuse me. But we're still waiting for somebody --
But you've got to wait. They said it's the only way over.
To protect her family, I guess.
I mean, it may show something about your attitude toward me, always being late.
Look, Skip, it wasn't your fault. It was an accident. You didn't know.
I don't want to hear about this.
How friendly will we feel once we've finished with those beans?
So it's going to be one of those dinners, huh?
I think we should change the subject.
Rob knows. He's going to medical school.
Why? You had your meeting with your counselor, didn't you?
Muffy, anything you want to add to that?
You still angry with me? About dinner?
I don't know. I'm scared. I don't know if I want what Mom and everybody else expects of me. I don't want to go to law school.
It's made up about one thing though.
We saw him... on a boat... drifting by the pier. He wasn't movinq. He looked dead... unless he was joking...!
I think it's about time we called the police.
I don't think we should wait any longer...
Rob? No, we haven 't been able to get through to the mainland yet.
It's okay, Nikki. With the others... they were outdoors. But we're inside now, and we're safe.
...doesn't understand. She glances at the walls for more pictures.
I just came in to make sure everything was secure to lock the windows.
Rob's checking the back of the house.
Stop it! Just stop it all of you!
What is wrong with us? Nhat happened to all our talk about friendship, and undying loyalty?
Do you know what we're saying? That we're actually sitting here discussing the possibility that Muffy, a generous friend, has invited us all here to --
No one's been up here in years.
Or... he's chosen not to use it.
So that's why you let her go upstairs?
What did he mean by that?
Rob, wait a minute. What's that?
Maybe he went on to the house.
Miss .St. John? What's it talking about? Muffy hasn't been in any state mental institution for the last three years -- she's been at Vassar!
Rob, I really don't want to go back there.
Rob, look! The doors. They've been closed.
...the picture of the girls in the study... the letter... what the Constable was trying to tell you... It's not Muffy it's her twin sister, Buffy! She has a twin sister!
Buffy?... please, we didn't mean any harm... we're leaving... we just want to go home... please... please...
Oh, fuck you!! Fuck you, you guys!!
What's this all about? And don't anyone say "April Fool's" or I'll smack them in the teeth.
Which means, I guess, that you're no constable either.
I don't care what Columbia says about you.
Is this the road to med school?
I don't know. Too much champagne?
Well, I hate to say it -- I still ought to kill you -- but thanks.
Well, I kinda like the idea -- and I don't have work to get back to.
Muffy can dish it out. It might be interesting to see if she can take it.
So how many does that make us?
Cal, we want to get back to the island.
Muffy! Stop him! Help! He's killing me! Oh, God! He's killing me!
Yeah, sure... I fuck on the first date...
Hi. Arch Cummings . I've seen you around. Jewett Hall, right?
Try to control yourself, Sister O'Toole.
C'mon, give it a fuckin' rest!
I'll get him, I'll get him!
We got 'em! Whoo-ee, did we nail 'em!
You sound as if you own it.
Yeah, I could get real used to this.
And napkins with little Hallmark bunnies! Gee, Muff, you really spared no expense.
Please, God, let it be ding dongs.
Well, Harvey's got his job interview all figured out, but what about the rest of us? Anybody know what they're going to be doing come graduation?
This is really incredible. Look at us... Here we are... privileged, independent, the hope of the future... and most of us still don't know what we're going to do with our lives!

Oh, shit, him too? That's what my guy said! An' I said, you're kidding! How can anybody be serious about anything when some moron can steal a bomb or push a button and blow the rest of us right into Mad Max. He wasn't impressed.
Well fuck you. It sounded good at the time.
I cherish all the friends I make.
Hey, all right... ladies, we are qonna have privacy...
Undaunted, he scuttles down the hall to Rob and Kit's closed door to listen in. He frowns, the slides farther down to Nikki's room, knocks once softly, and enters.
What do you think? That guy on the ferry?
I say we go looking for him, him or Skip. One of them's bound to still be around... somewhere.
Hey, shithead! chickendick!... yeah, you! Skip!
You bastard, you were in on the whole deal, too.
So what castle are you going to inherit?
You're telling me. Man, when I was swinging around out there in the woods, I nearly crapped my pants.
Well, it's like pranks really piss people off. It unleashes things, you know? Makes any kind of behavior possible, and we accept it.
Yeah. Enough's enough. At least for me anyway.
Bullshit. St. John blood is thicker than water, that's what you mean.
Chaz, Arch already has her bag.
This is it? No going back? Trapped for days on an island where men are men, and women oughta know better?
You could tie me in chains...
I get it. That's a joke.
Except for Skip and Nan. Them we just met.
This is true. For as long as I've known her.
Muffers, Moffo, Muff-child , Muffin' stuff, the Muffster...
Actually, she's three months older than I am.
Harvey... are you planning a career in politics when you grow up?
You maniacs... you almost gave us a heart attack!
Texas. You might be talking to your future boss, Harve.
On a clear day you can see the Kennedys.
The old-fashioned way. He inherited it.
...if only the choices weren't so limited. God, I'm so ready for a change. Any kind of change.
Like how much older are we talking about? Twenty-six?
Come sit on daddy's knee, little girl...
St. John hospitality taken to the extreme.
I mean, what are you' supposed to do with a liberal arts major anyway?
You've outdone yourself again, St. John.
I know you and Arch had something going before I met him...
I guess what I'm trying to say is... you always seem to get there first... but this time Chaz is mine, OK?
I don't like this... I definitely don't think I like this...
Jesus. I'll go. Just point me in the right direction.
You mean, back home on the farm?
It's like the very guts have been torn out of her. She screams, stumbling back.
In the well ! Oh, God, the well!
We have to leave, all of us, we have to get away.
It's all because of what happened on the ferry, isn't it?
She's been acting less than normal anyway.
You mean all day and you haven't noticed?
The clodhoppers she's been wearing today... crepe soles...
I found somethin"g in my room, too  She reaches into her bag and pulls out the black rubber bondage hood.
...only I don't think it was intended for me .
What I'd like to know is, how did Muffy find out about these things and why -- ?
We're starting to get on each other's nerves.
What do you mean, Nikki, come on? Don't give me any of this Nikki, come on.
Look, stay if you like. Lock your door. Dig a trench. Hang out. But once I leave this place, I'm never coming back.
Then I'll swim all the way back to the mainland... I can be strong if I have to.
Three people are dead and you're telling me to relax?
Now I'm supposed to throw off my clothes and jump on you? Just wind her up and watch her go? You've got a lot to learn, buddy.
What is this? Show and tell?
I'll show you mine if you show me yours?
Well, forget it... You may as well just stick it back in your pants.
We all got sucked in just as bad as you!
God... don't tell me that was something you learned on the farm!
More than this a couple of days ago.
I'll tell you what I've learned from all this. I'm tired of having one fling after another. I don't want any more of that. I want a boyfriend.
Chaz? Will you be my boyfriend?
Go back and give her a taste of her own medicine, that's what we should do.
She sure wouldn't be expecting it...!
Buck, got any spare professional tricks you could throw our way!
No, no, nothing's wrong. Chaz and I just figured there was nothing we had to get back to that couldn't wait and you could probably use a hand with the clean-up. It's our way of saying thank you.
Putting the boat up in the old boathouse. He'll be up in a minute.
I wonder what's keeping Chaz? He should have been up here by now.
Still... I'm beginning to not like this.
The boat? Oh, Cal gave us one.
Listen, I need a drink of water.
You just stay here. I can get it myself.
No, really. I don't want to go alone. I'm still scared from last night. Please come with me.
No, that's okay. I'll be fine.
Fuck!! Who dug the goddamn swimming pool?!?
A lot goddamn, fucking better than I do!
Chaz, stop playing around! Get up!!
It's supposed to hurt! The game's over! Get up!
Muffy IS dead!!! In the house!!!
Chaz! somebody's still in this house!
Somebody else is here! In this house!
Muffy, it's not a game anymore!
Thanks... for the lift, I mean...

Replies.Didascalie: (to Skip and Nan whom he doesn't know)

Replies.Reply: You don't want me to hitch, you want me to buy a car. OK, but I'm a state university boy, I don't have the perks like some of you private college kids do.
What a way to start a weekend, huh.
I wonder how Buck is doing?
We can talk about it some other time.
He said my grades might be OK; but that basically I possess an essential lack of seriousness, and that's what they look for.
He's right. That's bullshit on parade.
No. I'm sorry. I'm not angry with you. I'm just angry.
I swear it wasn't this cold yesterday .
What about you? What about your future? You're the one with the four point.
...maybe it's crazy--you investing so much energy in me.
Great... Do you realize how perfectly unmatched we are?
Will you feel the same about me a year from now? Two years, five years from now?
starts to wonder whether it really is a joke. He hurries forward, plunging 'into the water to reach the boat.
Goddammit, can't you give me a straight answer!
Has anybody seen him since last night?
I don't know. I don't know what to think.
Let's not take any chances. He was... He was pretty big.
We can't get away. Everyone back into the house . Now.
Constable Potter... Thank God it's you...
With Muffy? What do you mean?
Yes, all right... Please... Please hurry.
He's on his way. We're supposed to wait here... to stay together...
It isn't him. They've been together all day.
He's going to send up a flare as he's nearing the dock. Then we're to go down as a group to meet him there.
In the meantime... we just wait.
Muffy? We should all stay together.
I'm goinq to find the way up to the attic.
I'm sure we can watch for the Constable better from up there.
NO. There must not be a light on the boat.
Kit? He said something else on the phone, about Muffy.
He said not to trust anybody. That's why we were to stay together. No one was to be left alone with anyone else... Then he said, especially not with Muffy.
That's why I let her go.
I don't know. He wouldn't explain it.
Is it? He's known her longer than we have.
It's Arch and Skip and Nan.
If there's another flare, we can signal him.
years and is still considered incorrigibly unstable and extremely dangerous..."
I don't know... but we've gotta get this boat started.
The house. Didn't Muffy say there was another key back in the kitchen?
I'd have you stay here, but--
Listen, Kit, we'll get out of here, I promise you. We've been through so much together...
The stairs... Where are the stairs?...
The boat key... it's gotta be here...
Kit... I  He steps in, following his beam into the darkness. The cupboard door SLAMS shut behind him. He turns, trapped.
Kit! Let me out! Let me out of here! Kit!!
Kit! I love you! I love you, Kit!
Oh, sure. Quite welcome. Any time.
So I guess there's no crazy twin sister Buffy?
You're lucky you didn't get yourself killed.
Boy, what a difference being alive makes.
I think it is. I'm going to try.
But if I make it or not, no matter what happens, we'll be together?
What really amazes me is how easy we made it for her. Everyone was just out for himself. We could've stopped Muffy cold if we'd only stuck together, if we'd only worked like a team.
Look, what're you talking about? We've had our fun. Now we got work to do.
What the fuck do you think he was talking about?
What a great idea this was.
I thought we looked there an hour ago.
It was a real lift for me, too, hon.
The rooms are all in order, double- and triple-checked, and I'm on my way...
Sure you don't want me to stay? There's nobody gonna be around here to help till first ferry back Monday, y'know...
All right, then. Have a nice party.
No, Clara, thanks. Just trying some last minute straightening down here... god, I don't think I've ever worked so hard in my life...!
Nope, you're a peach, Clara. But this one's mine. I told my father I'd do it, and I will. My way. I don't want him to have any excuses.
Nice? It has to be better than nice... it's gotta be bloody unforgettable!
What's going on? Sam... what's wrong?
No, he's in Sutton Place. Why?
We keep all the keys on the board in the kitchen, but I think there's an extra one underneath the cushion there.
Well, there's an awful lot to be done with this place.
We used to spend our summers here before my mother died.
This is a very special place to me.
Why not? How do you think father made all his money?
Well, you know, everything they say about older men? It's true.
It was only a weekend. It's over now.
Kit... I don't think Rob really wants to talk about it in front of everybody.

In his "Life of Johnson" James Boswell said, "We cannot tell the precise moment when friendship is formed. As in filling a vessel drop by drop, there is at last a drop which makes it run over; so in a series of kindnesses, there is at last one which makes the heart run over."
So with this toast may our hearts run over and our friendships be formed.
Just holler if you need anything.
Arch is sweet, but he's only got two expressions. Collar up and collar down.
Arch do you know what time it is?
I... I must look a mess...
I... don't know what you're talking about.
Eight-two-four-eight. Constable Potter has an office at his home.
I didn't know what kind anybody would like so I just... got them all...
It happens sometime... But there's still the well all the island homes have some kind of pump... or well... for emergencies.
I'm not worried. I'm sure those two... Skip and Art... they're just up to some kind of stupid trick . . .
Guns? We don't keep guns in this house.
Good idea. Sometimes... with the tides... it can take someone all night to get here from the mainland... and even then, sometimes they don't make it...
You guys are really terrific. I love you all. And I thank you from the bottom of my heart for being such good sports.
Rob, you and Kit, you two were the best. You figured it all out. The clues really worked.
How about if I told you it was the script for a weekend special that's going to help me keep this house...

Look, next month I get the house as part of my inheritance, it's true, but only if I can show my father that it can carry itself... what with taxes and expenses. Otherwise, he'll just sell it out of the family.
Once they were killed off, yes. Everybody had to cooperate. Otherwise, none of it would have worked!
Oh, there's a crazy twin all right, but his name isn't Buffy.
Buck Williams. make-up artist par excellence, from Hollywood.
Kit Graham, meet my Uncle Frank St. John of St. John et Freres, Wall Street.
Usually we don't even see Uncle Frank in the summer, he's so busy.
Cal's our regular ferryman between the mainland and the islands around here... but I thought he was up to the dramatic challenge.

I almost did with Harvey. And who could know there would be a snake out in the woods with Arch? But with the paying guests, they'll know what they're in for: and the scenario won't be nearly so extreme.
...And I regret that, well, some of those fake clues I planted in the bedrooms I guess were taken too seriously. I'm sorry about that.
But we had fun, didn't we? I mean, come on.
I know I'll never forget this weekend for as long as I live.
Oh, Uncle Frank, he's been a great help this weekend, really. Let me get him out here so you can--
Let me say again how sorry I am. It wasn't intended.
I know. The clean-up's going to take Clara and me at least a week.
Oh, Skip, you dope. You know Daddy'll come around just as soon as you decide to buckle down.
I'll try not to act too surprised when they arrive.
Nikki, what on earth are you doing here? Is something wrong?
Maybe he stopped to shit in the woods. You know Chaz.
By the way, where did you get the boat to come back here?
That's okay. You go. I'll wait here.
I'm sure Chaz is fine. I'll stay here by the phone just in case. It's safer this way.
Good job, you guys. I'm really scared.
Let's see if the dead are ticklish, shall we?
Chaz Vyshinsky. You got great legs.
Your fly's open, and your Hostess Twinkie's hanging out...
You're friends with... Muffy St. John?
Watch what you say around him, though. He's Muffy's cousin.
fastens onto Nan, immersed in one of her books. He carries his own.
The origins of American pornographic film. I'm taking an independent study this term.
My advisor's really behind me on it. We're not gonna be sheltered college kids all our lives. Someday I'm gonna have kids --
April Fools... you crazy jerks. You crazy motherfuckin' jerks...
Look! Our very own place settings... with our very own place cards -- with Ken or Barbie! Outasight!
One of us in this room...
Boy, Muff, you sure know how to make a guy look forward to dessert.
Hey, no shit? You got early acceptance?
What is this? Dom Perignon sparkling rose?
. Unless Muffy knows something about us we don't.
That depends on what he's on.
Respectable young Quaker couple returning after quiet afternoon of nonviolent sex.
Wait a minute! Look at this!
It was an accident. Don't they know that?
Wait a minute. Aren't we supposed to be staying together? Where're Muffy and Rob?
I spent the night with Nikki.
Oh, come on, sport. I walked in on you last night , and you were acting like your ass was on fire...
Nothing personal in that, I suppose?
We're all supposed to stay together here.
So what are you going to do? Just waltz on down to the pier. By yourself. Check your bag with the porter. Then wait for an ocean liner to happen by and pick you up. Is that it?
I can't stay here any longer.
What if the Constable never even comes?
Nikki, now just hold on a minute, and look at me. Look at me.
Now, am I nervous? Yes. Maybe even a little bit scared? Yes.
I mean, come on, babe. Lighten up a little, huh?
Look at this. What, me worry?
You've got to look on the bright side of things. Everything'll be all right... Huh? Huh?
Oh. Now I'm turning you on. Right?
Why? I kind of like it in here.
Ooooh, stop it some more. I love it when you're rough.
Course it would help a little if I could breathe in here. For when things start to get really passionate.
Just what we need. Another country inn.
Why? What do we mean to each other anyway?
A couple of days ago... A couple of days ago I was a great, young, budding filmmaker who was going to turn pornography into high art.
Yeah, she really got us good.
Go back and scare the shit outta her for a change? Outrageous!
What the fuck was he talking about anyway? We might find something around after we dock?
Who cares? Let's get this show on the road!
Did you find a key? How're we going to get the motor started?
She wouldn't come out? Doesn't she care about me?
Will you quit kicking me? It hurts.
No. I'm dead. You're blowing the whole thing. Where's Muffy?
What the fuck is going on here?!
Hi... is this the ferry to the St. John house?
Oh, thank goodness ! I didn't know if I was on the right road...
Oh, no... just some work for finals, when we get back... you don't know how far behind I am...
Well, I only met Muffy this term in Drama Society . I volunteered to do their costumes... I like to sew... Did you see her in Ghosts? She's so talented. She was wonderful!
Milton. Paradise Lost. For Professor Russo's course on the English epic... It's a shame. It's a dying form. Not too many people read it nowadays, even in college. What's yours?
I used to have all her outfits.
Skip, you're giving up. You're giving up before you've even gotten started.
Look at how young we all are. How young and foolish and innocent and stupid...
Do you think we should call or something?
I can't decide. I'd like to go to graduate school in English. I love the sound of our language. But I'm afraid there's not much future in it.
Because... they'll be the friends you cherish most the rest of your life. So, well, here's to us... here's to my life... because I'm very glad to be here, and to be a part of all of you...
Besides, I thought I'd wait and see what Muffy wanted to do...
I know why you're avoiding me...
I guess it's your idea of a joke... that's why you invited me. How'd you find out? From one of his preppy 'friends'? Who else have you told?... Who else knows, except the father!
Oh? The tape just got there? You know very well... my abortion!
I thought you wanted to be friends... you think you can play with people's feelings just because you're rich and can do what you want.
And now all is forgiven. I played along, didn't I? What's done is done.
I've learned a lot, Muffy, I really have. I suppose I should say thank you, but I don't think I would be able to without it sounding false.
No, I don't think so, thank you.
You up for a game of stretch?
C'mon, just one more  The others look up at the interruption.
One more try, double or nothing.
Nan screams. Skip stumbles, teetering there at the edge of the ferry.
I was really counting on these other turkeys to save my ass.
Muffy. Nothing bad ever happens to her.
The poor boy can say, "Fuck you, Dad. I'm my own person." What is his father going to do? Kick him out of the house? Disinherit him? His life won't have changed that much. He's got nothing to lose.
That's already been lost. Died a long, long time ago.
Only the set-up. Muffy told me to say I was her cousin and to pull that prank on the ferry. I had no idea what was going to happen with Buck.
Well, I know what I'd do, if I wasn't her brother...
Nothing. Just calling to tell you the party's not over.
No, I mean, some of the gang's planning on coming back to give you some of your own medicine.
Does a bear shit in the woods?
That wouldn't be very sporting if I told you, would it?
Rob and Kit and Nikki and Chaz.
Well, Uncle Frank told me about his recommendations. So, I didn't want you to think there were any hard feelings.
Anyway, don't let the bastards eat you up.
A petty consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.
Don't you know? Old money sticks together.
It's all over, Muffy! Everything'll be mine!
To the rear. Outa the operator's way.
It's Friday. My last run of the week. I don't get paid overtime.
Ok, c'mon, I don't have all day.
C'mon I'm gonna need some help here.
And watch out for the wire!
Easy Buck... it's OK... OK... There's time for Later... easy...
...but you might find something around after we dock.
Just some old props I redressed with the help of photographs Muffy sent me.
Hi! Harvey 'Hal' Edison, Jr., but please call me Hal. Only my folks call me Harve... and I can't stand it. Boy, this sure is a pretty spot.
Y'know what I find amazin'? Muffy's her real name. I mean, I'm Harvey, but they call me Hal, so I thought, 'Muffy', it must stand for something... Muffin?
I bet you're her oldest friend.
I've given it some thought. Why?
First, though, I'm hopin' to interview with her daddy's company, Southern Regional Sales, next year before graduation...
I think it's real friendly. Makes me feel right at home.
Don't tell me you've never thought of me in that way, Muffy. I felt a spark between us the very first moment we laid eyes on each other...
Why just think of it... Muffers, with my raw... driving talent and your...
He puzzles, taking down the clipping, putting it down on the dresser as he moves there to put away his rolled socks. He opens the top drawer.
Sorry... I was just checkin' to make sure everybody was all right.
I don't think you should really do that.
Here, let me do it. I've probably had more experience than you.
I know you think I'm a hick, but I'd like to change your mind about that, if you'd only give me the chance.
Because, I'd really like to plow your field.
Hal. The rope was rotten, any fool coulda seen that.
Here, shine your light down so I can get a fix on it.
Muffy, where do you keep your guns?
She was arguing with Nan in the hall, before you and Rob... before you came back alone.
About something Nan found in her room.
I don't know What you're talking about.
It wasn't anything... Just some clippings... of some car accidents.
No! Who hasn't been in a car accident? It's a common thing.
As long as we all stay within shouting distance of each other...
It's all right. I can keep watch on the stairs.
Hi! Harvey "Hal" Edison, Jr. Pleased to meet you, sir.
Well, I don't know. I got a stack o' books this high...
Well, can I look you up in a couple of months? Maybe you could arrange a job interview for me.
Thank you, sir. Thanks a lot. I sure appreciate it, and it's been a real pleasure meeting you.
Hey, wait a minute! There's no phone number here! No address! No nothing!
at their game. Arch stretches, can't reach the knife, and topples over.
Nikki, much to her chagrin, finds herself the object of Harvey's attentions.
Get him to the hospital, Cal! Take my boat!
Tricks. Pranks. Better ask your friends... Buck's been hurt. 'Cal just took him on over to the mainland. Just lucky I was here...
I came over to check on a report of some unauthorized activity in the area... Your dad around?
No word from him, or anybody else?
Just like I thought. . Burned out. Worthless...
I'll have to borrow your outboard to get back to shore.
I'm glad you're stuck here, all o' you. If there's anvthin' else, or anything happens to Buck... I want to know where to find you.
Well, first he's got to prove he can manage his own allowance.
The better to eat you with, my dear.
as Arch stalks forward, not looking at the ground.
as Arch hears a noise. He stops. SOMEONE ELSE is here with him, very nearby.
He stops again, looks all around him, then turns once more and starts to move very slowly with short little steps back in the other direction.
Arch valorously steps back, closing the door and returning to try Nan.
She shines the beam down again, bending in for a look.
And I'm telling you, I'm here at the hospital now visiting Buck. He came out of surgery last night--It might interest you to know he'll be all right-- and Cal's been here too, the whole time.
Rob clicks on the beam in the direction they went and sees the stairs.
A long, ugly-looking knife blade slips in through the crack in the door. Buffy is using it to try to pry open the door.
Rob opens the door. Success. His beam falls on the key board on the inner wall.
I haven't had this much fun since my Hasty pudding Show sophomore year at Harvard. God, lowe you kids!
Otherwise, even Lloyd's of London won't cover you.
It's all right, Arch. They'll be out of the dryer soon.
Well, if the food's any indication, it's already half-way there.
I'll make a full and glowing report to your father tomorrow so he can draw up the deed along with the other trust papers for Wednesday's signing. I'm so proud of you.
I wish I could say the same about your brother.
His conduct and his academic performance remain inexcusable. He knows your father can't be expected to entrust him with anything until he shows some signs of responsibility and initiative.
Come on. If time is money, we're losing a fortune.
Cal, I want to thank you personally. You've been a real sport about this.
I know you've had your eye on that p1ace ever since we were kids.
How'd I do? I never did no acting before. Boy, was I shaking!
What do you mean, nearly? I was there, remember?
The St. John Island Bar Harbor ferry leaves in thirty minutes. No stragglers, please.
Hey! What are you two doing down there?!
Oh', uh, I drank 'it in there.
Listen. Muffy , I'm really getting worried about Chaz. I think we should go out and see what's happened.
